screen_name: @TheAlphaDoug But I get your point - people may be *more* prone to make reservations in this climate. Still, using reservations as a proxy for total traffic (which is what many people are doing) seems like a stretch to me

A few reflections of this review I wrote earlier THIS MONTH* in light of our totally different world:

1) Q: Can a new (nonhuman) enemy unite us against a common enemy just like during the Cold War? A: No

*How is it still March? https://t.co/qVHk507bnO

But here's where I wonder why Klein assumes we have to turn on each other...something like the Cold War or 9/11 can give us an external enemy we unify against. Is polarization the "opiate of the masses," as @tylercowen recently suggested?
The "Temporary" aspect is much much less important now...keep these supports indefinitely until it's clear how long this pain will last.

@GwailoMD @MatthewDownhour @adamgurri I can come up with practical reasons! Just not ones that are consistent with his framework. Also: 1) my homestate of Illinois elected a GOP gov recently b/c the Dem machine is so corrupt that people probably wanted to shake things up. Dunno if this applies to New England states.

Further, our psychology is set up to be aggravated much more by what we're against than what we stand for. So negativity dominates/motivates, and thus our loathing for the other side reaches a fever pitch.
